137068.description:
Classify a document containing food item as belonging to this category only if it meets both of the following conditions:

1. **Food Information Present:** The document must contain either:
   - A food ingredients list (with items such as "wheat", "lactic acid"), or  
   - Nutritional information presented as a nutrition table (including details such as "Calories", "Carbohydrates", "Fats", "Potassium").

2. **Keyword Requirement:** The document must include at least one of these keywords (in any case):  
   'ingredient,' 'ingredients,' 'Ingredient,' 'Ingredients,' 'nutrition fact,' 'Nutrition Fact,' 'nutrition facts,' 'Nutrition Facts', 'Nutritional Information'.

Documents that do not satisfy both conditions should be ignored.

415288.description: Extract the serving size mentioned in the Nutrition Facts table, such as 'serving size' or 'per serving,' or "per" e.g., '1 piece (19g).' Ensure to capture the entire phrase including the quantity and unit.
415288.name: Serving Size

415289.description: Extract all allergen information from the food label, specifically starting from keywords like  "Contains", "CONTAINS", "contain", "CONTAIN", "May contain", "MAY CONTAIN", "may contain", "Must contain", "MUST CONTAIN", "must contain", "Allergens", "ALLERGENS", "allergens". Provide the full text exactly as it appears.
415289.name: Allergen Information

415290.description: Extract the complete address associated with "Imported by," "Distributed by," or "Packed in," including the company name, street address, city, state, and postal code. Exclude any details related to the manufacturer or producer.

lines.prompt: find the country from the address.
Use the official English name of the country

415290.name: Imported from

416429.description:
Extract macronutrient Nutritional Facts or Nutritional Information from the document and format them into a structured table with the following fixed columns: Nutrient, Amount (with unit), and % Daily Value (if available). The table should include only macronutrients, which are fixed as Calories, Total Fat, Saturated Fat, Trans Fat, Polyunsaturated Fat, Monounsaturated Fat, Cholesterol, Sodium, Total Carbohydrates, Dietary Fiber, Total Sugars, Added Sugars, and Protein. Ensure correct alignment and readability.

The extracted data should represent the upper half of the Nutrition Facts table, before Micronutrients.

'Percent Daily Value' of Calories is always empty.
416429.name: Macronutrient Nutritional Table

prompt_schema.description: The name of the nutrient extracted from the nutritional label, e.g., Example: Carbohydrate 10g 20% — here, Carbohydrate is the nutrient value.
prompt_schema.name: Nutrient

prompt_schema.description: The weight of the nutrient, listed after its name. Example: Carbohydrate 10g 20% — here, 10g is the Amount for Carbohydrate. If missing, leave it blank.
prompt_schema.name: Amount

prompt_schema.description: Percent Daily Value (%DV) is the percentage of the daily recommended intake for the nutrient, listed after the amount. Example: Carbohydrate 10g 20% — here, 20% is the %DV for Carbohydrate. If missing, leave it blank.
prompt_schema.name: Percent Daily Value

417106.description: Extract micronutrient Nutritional Facts or Nutritional Information from the document and format them into a structured table with columns: Nutrient, Amount (with unit), and % Daily Value (if available). Include only vitamins and minerals such as Vitamin D, Calcium, Iron, Potassium, and any other listed micronutrients. The extracted data should represent the lower half of the Nutrition Facts table, after the macronutrients (Protein, Cholesterol, Sodium
417106.name: Micronutrient Nutrition table

prompt_schema.description: Nutrient is the name of the nutrient extracted from the nutritional label, e.g., Iron 5g 30% — here, Iron is the nutrient
prompt_schema.name: Nutrient

prompt_schema.description: Amount is the weight of each nutrient, listed after the nutrient name. Example: 'Vitamin A 5g 30%' — here, 5g is the Amount for Vitamin A. If Amount is missing, leave it blank.
prompt_schema.name: Amount

prompt_schema.description: Percent Daily Value (%DV) is the percentage for each nutrient, listed after the weight. Example: 'Vitamin D 5g 30%' — here, 30% is the 'Percent Daily Value' for Vitamin D. If 'Percent Daily Value' is missing, leave it blank.
prompt_schema.name: Percent Daily Value

482824.description: Extract all the ingredients listed on this food label. Provide the full list exactly as it appears, without adding or removing anything.

lines.prompt: remove french ingredients name from the result

482824.name: Ingredients List

491471.description: Search the document for the country where the product was manufactured by identifying phrases such as 'Product of' or 'Made in'.

lines.prompt: Use the official English name of the country

491471.name: Product of

137068.name: Food Nutrition and ingredients

137185.description:
Classify a document into this category only if it is a medicine, drug, or supplement that contains  an "Drug Facts" table", and contains at least one of the following words:
"Ingredient," "Ingredients," "ingredient," "ingredients," "Inactive," "inactive," "Active," "active," "Facts," "fact," "facts," "Fact,"  "Drug," "drug," "supplement," or "Supplement,"

If the document contains elements such as directions, a warning section, active ingredients, inactive ingredients, allergy, expiry date, barcode, the name and address of the manufacturer or an ingredients table, storage conditions, classify to this category

408862.description: Extract the names and dosages of all active ingredients listed in the medicine or drug.
408862.name: Active Ingredients

prompt_schema.description: Contains the name of the active ingredient e.g ibuprofen
prompt_schema.name: Name

prompt_schema.description: Contains the weight of the Active Ingredient e.g 100mg
prompt_schema.name: Weight

416427.name: Warnings
416427.prompt: Extract the text under the Warnings section, if it exists. Else return "None Found"

416428.description: Is there a Warnings section table in the document? If yes extraction the text under it.
416428.name: Allergy Alert
416428.prompt: Is there a Allergy Alert section in the document? If yes extraction the text under it. Else return "None Found"

417060.description: Extract all the ingredients listed under the heading "Inactive ingredients" or  "Inactive ingredient". e.g corn starch
417060.name: Inactive Ingredients

137185.name: Medicine Ingredients and Facts

146163.description: Classify a document as the front label of a medicine only if it contains the product name, brand name or logo, dosage information (e.g., "12 caplets," "500 mg"), and marketing claims (e.g., "Pain reliever," "Extra strength"). Do not classify if the document contains any of the words - "Ingredients," "ingredient," "ingredients," "Ingredient," "Inactive," "inactive," "Active," "active," "Drug Facts," "Drug Fact," "Supplement Facts," "Supplement Fact,"

446590.description: Extract the names and dosages of all active ingredients listed in the medicine or drug.
446590.name: Ingredients

146163.name: Medicine Front Label

146189.description: Classify a document if it contains a food product name, description, brand name, marketing claims, Net Quantity, key claims and certifications. **Do not classify** if it contains the words 'Calories', 'ingredient,' 'Ingredients,' 'nutrition fact,' 'Nutrition Fact,' 'nutrition facts,' 'Nutrition Facts', 'Nutritional Information', or any Nutrition Facts table. Ignore documents with these elements.
146189.name: Food Product Front Label
